definition: cuckoo (Cercococcyx spp.)/same as 杜鵑鳥|杜鹃鸟[du4 juan1 niao3]
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: A cuckoo began calling from a hawthorn tree .
sentences.chinese: 一只布谷鸟开始在一株山楂树里咕咕地呼叫。

sentences.english: Accompanied by cuckoo, the sun also ek-sistent smile. This is the beginning of this story.
sentences.chinese: 伴着布谷鸟的叫声，太阳也绽出了笑容。

sentences.english: I came home just in time to hear the cuckoo clock cuckoo three times.
sentences.chinese: 我回到家时刚好听到家里的布谷鸟钟响了三下。

sentences.english: The cuckoo harbingers the coming of spring.
sentences.chinese: 布谷鸟告知春天的到来。

sentences.english: And what cuckoos say you know.
sentences.chinese: 你该知道布谷鸟怎么叫。

sentences.english: I realized my wife would probably wake up, so I cuckooed another 9 times.
sentences.chinese: 我想老婆可能会醒来，于是学布谷鸟又多叫了九声。

sentences.english: And what cuckoos says you know.
Gowk is another name for a cuckoo bird.
sentences.chinese: “杜鹃鸟”是“布谷鸟”的另一种叫法。

sentences.english: The cuckoo standing in the branches sang the rhyme of spring.
sentences.chinese: 布谷鸟也站在了枝头唱起了春天的童谣。

definition: to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
(bird species of China) azure-winged magpie (Cyanopica cyanus)
